column1: 500Qk00000FkJyJIAV,"00421041","Support Ticket","CDSA job producing inaccurate information","SharePoint and Weak passwords showing 100% in summaries.  This sticks out as being inaccurate.

I believe Farah may already be tracking these efforts","","We recently put the CDSA through a thorough regression test and have seen some issues with it escalated or otherwise brought to PM's attention, so I wanted to provide a list of known, outstanding issues the NEA team are working through so folks are aware when presenting the CDSA to customers:

column2: # resources contain sensitive data"" count is slightly off
Counts for each platform in the ""RESOURCES WITH SENSITIVE DATA BY PLATFORM"" chart are inaccurate
Under ""Exploitable Permissions"" the counts for Container, Full Control, and Reset Password are inaccurate.
In the Exploitable Permissions section ""contains"", ""domain compromise"" and ""member of"" will be removed as those are steps in the shadow access attack path rather than exploitable permissions
The percentage of resources that are openly accessible to users(in parentheses) is inaccurate
Resource counts (using the $Resources variable in the job script) are not properly including Oracle or SQLServer resources
Calculation for % of Resources with Open Access uses Site Collections for SharePoint but ""OPEN ACESS BY PLATFORM"" chart uses Sites, so they don't match. Both will be updated to use Site Collections

column1: The last ticket in the list is actively being worked on in the current sprint and the others are in the backlog to be pulled on and addressed once bandwidth allows. I'll provide updates on this thread as these get fixed.","R&D to provide fix","Hotfix available in this kb article: https://nwxcorp.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/General__kav/ka0Qk0000008xcPIAQ/view","Product defect","Paul Pitas","","Netwrix Enterprise Auditor","StealthAUDIT General","NEA Web Report Console","11.6","11.6.0.64","56.0","Closed - Resolved","Vinmar International","Paul Pitas","2024-09-13T19:42:33.000Z","2024-11-08T20:37:08.000Z"
